name: Sangallo Palace Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights the the hotel and expected much less than we got. As it is not an old place, it has a little less charm, but it makes up for this in competence, performance, and sheer warmth. The staff was extremely helpful to us, spending considerable time on suggestions for restaurants and hiking possibilities.
reviews.title: great hotel, really well-run and staffed

reviews.text: It was so nice to be in a large, quiet, well-designed room and a bathroom big enough that you we could unpack everything and never be in each others' way. At this point in our lives we prefer comfort to charm, chairs with support over the cute little wiry ones that you can't read a book on.
reviews.title: The finest hotel in which I have stayed in Italy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts were very good if, as almost always in Italy, a bit heavy on the high calorie stuff. We would love to see Italy serve some wonderful vegetables in their buffets. We made that suggestion to the staff and they were receptive.
reviews.title: Perfectly located to make Perugia a hub.

reviews.text: It's true that the hotel is below the old section of town, but it only took five minutes to go up the escalator and be in the wonderful old city.
reviews.title: Perfect Peugia - despite the rain!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We will definitely stay at Sangallo Palace when and if we return to Perugia.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay and location is very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked three nights at the Sangallo Palace but only ended up staying one. Fortunately, we hadn't pre-paid for our stay. The hotel was very basic, including the rooms. We stayed in May, not quite summer but not quite winter and the hotel had switched off their heating system. We arrived and it was cold and raining and we spent our first night shiffering in our room. We brought this to the attention of staff the next morning, asking if we could please have some heating and we were informed that it had been switched off and would not be switched back on until next winter. I couldn't help noticing that the shampoo bottles were being stacked into the dishwasher behind the small lobby bar. Not only that, but it seemed that every second light was off (no bulb) - clearly there was some cost cutting going on. Not willing to experience a second chilling night in the hotel, we checked out (after an uncomfortable scene with the female Manager). We will say that we found the Irish/Italian man on reception very friendly and he helped as much as he could but he was up against a hotel which was clearly struggling financially and had therefore cut services to a minimum. We moved on to Spoletto and stayed in a charming and very warm Villa. Be warned, Perugia is visually charming but there is a undercurrent of crime and drugs and we never felt entirely comfortable there.
reviews.title: No heating in this hotel during a very cold snap!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for a few days on a trip touring Italy. The staff on reception could not have been more helpful, spoke excellent English and gave us some very useful information.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with exceptional reception staff

reviews.text: The rooms were comfortable and well equipped and we would thoroughly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.
reviews.title: Would recommend

reviews.text: Modern hotel (not a lot of character), rooms were large, clean, comfortable. Right across the street from a bus stop, 5min by escalator/walk into the main old town area.
reviews.title: Great location and great hotel
Perfect Hotel in Perugia
reviews.text: WiFi for an acceptable charge. Did have a gym and pool I did not get to try. Large groups such as Insight Vacations can and do stay here. Not a place where you will be meeting other guests. Breakfast OK.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We originally booked this hotel since it was one of the few options in Perugia I could reserve with my credit card points. Therefore, I wasn't sure what to expect. However, I was very pleased with Sangallo Palace!
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, and great service

reviews.text: First, the staff was incredibly pleasant and helpful. They were very accommodating. The lobby was clean and elegant. The rooms were large and comfortable. The decor was fairly minimal and the bathroom resembled a US motel bathroom in its starkness, but was clean. The breakfast was big and filling and the staff made cappuccino and espresso to order.
reviews.title: Terrific Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is a bit out of the way if you want to explore central Perugia but its right by the bus station with easy connections to the historic center and the train station and walking distance to the center if you want to brave the incline. And the surrounding area itself isn't unpleasant, just a bit boring.
reviews.title: pleasant, great value, close to bus station and city centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, a well-priced hotel to explore Perugia and surrounding Umbria.
reviews.title: THE only place to stay when in Perugia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed in the Sangallo for 12 nights whilst away on business.
reviews.title: Perugia is a gem and SanGallo Palace makes it better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sangallo palace is a good option in Perugia. The rooms are ample and well appointed. It is a short walk to Perugia historical center (using the escalators). The interior pool and small gym is nice to relax after a day walking.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in Perugia but breakfast can improve a lot

reviews.text: It is a pity the industrial breakfast, probably suited to the Assisi pilgrims that come in big numbers. There are a lot of choices but, from the juice to the coffee or the bread, of a poor quality. It is a dark spot for a generally good hotel.
reviews.title: Bus Station Hotel with zero charme
Affordable luxury - a gem we would return to again and again.
reviews.text: I stayed at the Sangallo Palace Hotel in May 2010 and i booked it because of recommendations from Tripadvisors. It was at first place in the ranking back then. Unfortunately that was very misleading.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is one of the typical non-charming simple hotels that you find in thousands around Italy. Italians have great tase for fashion and food but they have no idea how a hotel should look like.
reviews.title: Great location, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The SanGallo Palace is not a Palace but a typically building from the seventies/sixties. Its build next to a bus station and you have to walk like 20-25 minutes to reach the old town which is very nice.
reviews.title: Good hotel in Perugia

description: An upscale hotel in the center of it all! Our beautifully renovated Sangallo Palace Hotel is located in the historical centre of Perugia a short stroll from the fascinating and historic Rocca Paolina Fortress. Visit the monuments and tourist attractions of the city centre on foot; relax in the covered swimming pool and use the fully equipped gym that the hotel offers you; enjoy the genuine Umbrian cuisine in our well known Restaurant "Il Sangallo".
